instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2337: What is 820-2337? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2337</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no response
threads.message:
Hi fellas,

No response WHATSOEVER when trying to turn on - no sign of life. First 2 red diagnostics indicators (CPUA + CPUB) are always on (with / without the CPU board) BUT when the front panel board is disconnected - those 2 indicators turn off. When DIAG LED button is pressed only 5V STBY turns on. PSU was replaced and tested. Any ideas?
Thanks.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2337</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no response
threads.message: There is no information on these boards. I have no idea how to help you, sorry. Only quick thing to test is the USB port data lines to see if the south bridge is dead.

threads.message: Any reason to revive 6 years old thread???
